### Documentation Checklist
<!-- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->

#### Content Quality
- [ ] Content is accurate and technically correct
- [ ] Content is complete (no TODOs or placeholders)
- [ ] Grammar and spelling are correct
- [ ] Writing follows the [style guide](../site_docs/contributing/style-guide.md)
- [ ] Code examples are tested and work
- [ ] Screenshots/images are clear and up-to-date

#### Structure & Formatting
- [ ] Proper heading hierarchy (H1 -> H2 -> H3)
- [ ] Frontmatter includes required fields (title, description, date)
- [ ] Internal links use relative paths
- [ ] External links open in new tab where appropriate
- [ ] Lists and tables are properly formatted

#### Discoverability
- [ ] Page is added to navigation in `mkdocs.yml` (if applicable)
- [ ] Appropriate tags added to frontmatter
- [ ] Cross-references added from related pages
- [ ] Search keywords are naturally included

#### Quality Checks
- [ ] Local build successful (`mkdocs serve`)
- [ ] No broken links
- [ ] Markdown linting passes (if configured)
- [ ] Prose linting reviewed (if configured)

#### Review
- [ ] Changes previewed locally
- [ ] Feedback incorporated from reviewers
- [ ] Technical accuracy verified by subject matter expert

### Deployment Notes
<!-- Any special considerations for deployment? -->
- [ ] No special deployment needed
- [ ] Requires navigation update
- [ ] Requires redirects (specify below)
- [ ] Other (specify below)

---

**Reviewer Guide:**
1. Check content accuracy and completeness
2. Verify formatting and structure
3. Test all links and code examples
4. Confirm proper navigation placement
5. Review for style guide compliance
